We may earn a commission from links on this page. Deal pricing and availability subject to change after time of publication.

Credit: Illustration by Zain bin Awais. Logo images courtesy of Max, Amazon, Apple, Disney, Hulu, and Netflix.

Streaming services have basically come full circle: What started as a cheap alternative to cable TV has become an expensive monthly cost in its own right, as price hikes and crackdowns on password sharing have made subscribing to multiple streaming services just as expensive, if not more so, than some conventional cable plans.

Luckily, there are often discounts, deals, and loopholes to exploit that can make streaming more affordable—and sometimes even free.

This month's best streaming deals

Two of the better streaming deals right now are easy to grab and don’t require any bundles or extra purchases. You can get three months of ad-supported Peacock Premium for free by using the promo code PEA2LOPP7EXU95. And over on Apple TV+, the MLS Season Pass is now half off, down to $49 for the season (for non-Apple TV+ subscribers) or $39 with an existing Apple TV+ subscription. If you’re looking to stream summer hits like Poker Face or catch every MLS match live, these are two of the easiest and cheapest ways to do it right now.

Here are the best of the rest of the streaming deals right now:

Amazon Prime Video

Credit: Amazon

Home to buzzy originals like The Boys, Reacher, and Fallout, plus a deep movie catalog.

  • You can try a 30-day free trial.

  • You can get a free Amazon Prime membership when you sign up for Metro by T-Mobile’s Flex Unlimited Plus plan.

  • Prime Video is also available on its own for $8.99 a month, so if you’re only in it for the shows and movies, you can skip the full Prime membership and save yourself six bucks a month.

  • Check out what's new on Prime Video, as well as the best Prime Video Original movies to watch.

AMC+

Credit: AMC+

Your go-to for The Walking Dead universe, Interview with the Vampire, and prestige dramas.

  • You can try AMC+ for $5 for the first month (regular price is $9.99/month) through Sling TV (scroll down to see the deal). You don't need a Sling plan to get this deal.

  • If you do sign up for a Sling subscription, you’ll get your first month of AMC+ for free.

  • You can also try a seven-day free trial.

  • Get 30 days of AMC+ free (ad-free plan) with code AMC30FT2—valid only for new Monthly or Annual Ad-Free subscriptions via amcplus.com.

  • You can get an annual subscription to ad-free AMC+ through Verizon's +play for $83.88 (saves you $3 per month).

  • You can bundle AMC+ with STARZ on Prime Video for $13.99 (saves $6.99/month).

Apple TV+

Credit: Apple TV+

Features critically acclaimed originals like Ted Lasso and Severance.

  • You can get a seven-day free trial of Apple TV+.

  • You can get a free subscription if you’re a T-Mobile customer with their Experience Plans.

  • Verizon’s One Unlimited for iPhone plan gives you an Apple TV+ subscription through its Apple One bundle.

  • You get three months of free Apple TV+ when you buy an Apple product.

  • Use this link to get three months of Apple TV+ free (for new or eligible returning subscribers). Offer valid through July 31, 2025.

  • If that doesn’t work, try this link to get one month free—valid through Jan 7, 2026.

  • You can get Apple Music for just $5.99/month with a student discount—and it comes with free access to Apple TV+.

  • You can get the MLS Season Pass for a 50% discount at $14.99 a month or $49 for the full season, saving you $49.

  • If you already subscribe to Apple TV+, you can get the MLS Season Pass for an even lower price of $12.99 a month or $39 for the full season, saving you $59.

  • Check out the best original series from Apple TV.

The Criterion Channel

Credit: The Criterion Channel

A haven for arthouse, international, and classic cinema.

  • This arthouse streamer is the best service for true movie buffs, and you can sign up for a free trial before being charged the $99.99 annual fee (which already represents a savings over the $10.99 cost of a monthly plan).

Crunchyroll

Credit: Crunchyroll

The top destination for anime, from new simulcasts to beloved classics.

  • Anime fans can try Crunchyroll free for seven days, with access to new episodes just hours after they air in Japan.

Curiosity Stream

Credit: Curiosity Stream

 A niche option for fans of science, history, tech, and real-world storytelling.

  • Save $19 when you sign up for a Standard Curiosity Stream annual plan, and $50 when you sign up for the Smart Bundle annual plan.

  • New users can also score $250 off a lifetime subscription to Curiosity Stream’s Standard plan.

DirecTV Stream

Credit: DirecTV Stream

Best if you still want a traditional channel lineup plus access to streamers like Max and STARZ.

  • You can get two years of Max, Paramount+ with Showtime, Starz, MGM+, and Cinemax with the purchase of the Premier package starting at $124.99 per month (it saves $20 per month, or $500 over two years).

  • Or you can try a five-day free DirecTV Stream trial.

  • You can also unlock 105+ free live channels just by signing up for MyFree DirecTV with your email and downloading the app.

Discovery+

Credit: Discovery+

 For reality TV and docu-series fans.

  • You can subscribe to Discovery+ ($9.99/month) as an add-on through Sling TV—no base plan required.

  • If you bundle it with Sling Blue or Sling Orange, you’ll get the first month free.

  • Or you can also get Discovery+ free for six months with select Verizon Unlimited plans—then you’ll have to pay $6.99/month after the trial ends.

  • There's also a seven-day free trial if you just want to test it out.

Disney+

Credit: Disney+

 Everything from Marvel to Mickey Mouse.

  • You can get the Disney+, Hulu, and Max bundle with ads for $16.99 (a 43% discount off its original 29.97/mo price)

  • Or you can get the Disney+, Hulu, and Max bundle without ads for $29.99 (a 42% discount off its original $51.97/mo price)

  • You can get Disney+ and Hulu (with ads) for $10.99 per month (save 44% per month).

  • You can get Disney+ and Hulu (no ads) for $19.99 per month (save 42% per month).

  • You can get Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+ (with ads) for $16.99 per month.

  • You can get Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+ (no ads) for $26.99 per month.

  • Verizon subscribers who have an Unlimited Ultimate plan have the option to include a Disney package, which provides them with Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+ (with ads) for just $10 monthly (save $6.99 per month).

  • You can also get Disney+ Basic with Spectrum’s TV Select Signature and TV Select Plus plans.

  • Check out what's new on Disney+.

FuboTV

Credit: FuboTV

A cable alternative focused on sports—think NFL, MLB, international soccer, and more.

  • Try a seven-day free trial of FuboTV.

  • If you’re a new subscriber, you get 30 days free of FuboTV Pro if you’re a My Best Buy Plus or Total member (save $84.99).

  • New subscribers also get $20 off the first month.

HBO Max

Credit: HBO Max

From HBO's prestige shows like Succession and The Last of Us to Discovery content.

  • You can get the new Disney+, Hulu, and Max bundle with ads for $16.99 (save $12.98/month).

  • Or you can get the Disney+, Hulu, and Max bundle without ads for $29.99 (save $21.98/month)

  • You can get Max (with ads) for $99.99 per year (save $19 per year over the monthly cost).

  • You can get Max (with no ads) for $169.99 per year (save $33)

  • You can get Max Premium (with no ads) for $209.99 per year (save $41 per year).

  • Verizon subscribers who have myPlan have the option to include a Netflix and Max bundle package with ads for just $10 monthly per line (save $7.98 per month).

  • Cricket Wireless includes Max (with ads) in its $60/month plan.

  • Or if you use DoorDash regularly, you could sign up for a DashPass Annual Plan, and you’ll get Max (with ads) included at no extra cost for a year.

  • Students get HBO Max Basic with Ads for just $4.99 per month, which is 50% off the regular $9.99 price.

  • Check out what's new on Max this month, and the best movies and TV shows to stream on Max.

Hulu

Credit: Hulu

Catch network shows the next day, plus Hulu Originals like The Bear and Only Murders in the Building.

  • You can get the Disney+, Hulu, and Max bundle with ads for $16.99.

  • Or you can get the Disney+, Hulu, and Max bundle without ads for $29.99.

  • Get an annual plan of Hulu (with ads) for $99.99 instead of $9.99 monthly (save $19.89)

  • You can get Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+ (with ads) for $16.99 per month.

  • Get Hulu + Live TV, Disney+, and ESPN+ (all three with ads) for $82.99 per month.

  • T-Mobile members can get Hulu at no cost through Hulu on Us with their Go5G Next or any Experience Beyond plan.

  • Students can get Hulu for $1.99 per month (as opposed to the regular $9.99/mo) after an 80% discount.

  • Verizon subscribers who have an Unlimited Ultimate plan have the option to include a Disney package, which provides them with Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+ (with ads) for just $10 monthly (save $6.99 per month).

  • You can also try a one-month free trial of the ad-supported Hulu plan, available to new and eligible returning subscribers.

  • Check out what's new on Hulu this month and the best Hulu Originals.

Magellen TV

Credit: Magellen TV

A smaller docu-streamer with a strong lineup of history, science, and war content.

  • You can get a seven-day free trial with monthly billing, or a 14-day free trial if you choose the annual plan.

  • You can get a subscription for $5.99/month, or save with annual billing at $4.99/month.

  • Or you can get a lifetime membership for $149.97 through StackSocial (regularly $199).

MGM+

Credit: MGM+

Rotating library of classic films and newer series like Godfather of Harlem.

What do you think so far?

  • You can try for free with a seven-day trial on Amazon Prime.

MHz Choice

Credit: MHz Choice

Specializes in international dramas, particularly European crime shows and thrillers.

  • You can try a seven-day free trial of the service.

  • Or get 30% off your first three months with promo code SUMMER25.

MLB.TV

Credit: MLB TV

Baseball fans, this one's for you. The official streaming home for out-of-market Major League Baseball games.

  • Start your free trial.

  • Get a 35% discount for military members through GOVX.

Netflix

Credit: Netflix

From Stranger Things to Bridgerton and Beef, Netflix is still a heavyweight in original content.

  • If you’re a Verizon customer, you can get a year of Netflix for free when you buy certain annual subscriptions through +play.

  • If you’re a Verizon customer, you can get Netflix for a year if you buy an annual subscription to STARZ or AMC+ through +play. Read the FAQ here.

  • Verizon subscribers who have myPlan have the option to include a Netflix and Max bundle package with ads for just $10 monthly per line (save $7.98 per month).

  • You can save on Netflix (Standard with ads) if you’re a T-Mobile customer with a Go5G Plus or Next plan.

  • Check out what's new on Netflix this month.

NFL+

Credit: NFL

Live local and primetime NFL games on mobile, plus replays and highlights.

  • You could get the NFL+ for $6.99/mo or $49.99/season.

  • Get NFL Sunday Ticket for $23 per month for your first year if you’re a new user.

Paramount+

Credit: Paramount+

Home to CBS shows, NFL games, Yellowstone spinoffs, and Showtime originals.

  • You can get Paramount+ for free when you sign up for a Walmart+ membership (or if you already have one) as part of your subscription.

  • Or if you have a Hulu subscription, you can add Paramount+ with Showtime for $0.99 per month for two months. This offer ends on 7/22.

  • You can save $35 by choosing the Paramount+ Premium annual plan at $119.99 per year after a one-week trial, instead of paying $12.99 each month.

  • Students get half off the regular price of any Paramount+ plan for their first 12 months.

  • Check out what's new on Paramount+ and Showtime.

Peacock

Credit: Peacock

The only place to stream The Office, Poker Face, live WWE, and the Premier League.

  • Students can get Peacock Premium for $2.99/month and teachers for $3.99/month—both for 12 months, down from the usual $7.99.

  • You can get three months of free ad-supported Peacock Premium using the promo code PEA2LOPP7EXU95, if you are a new Peacock subscriber.

  • Xfinity internet customers who sign up for NOW TV for $20 a month, which includes 40 live TV and on-demand channels, can get Peacock Premium for free for two years.

  • Instacart+ members get a free Peacock Premium annual membership, valued at $79.99.

  • Subscribe to any annual Peacock plan and get 12 months for the price of 10.

  • Here are the best original Peacock shows worth watching.

Philo

Credit: Philo

Budget-friendly live TV with lifestyle and entertainment networks.

  • You can try a seven-day free trial of Philo.

Showtime

Credit: Paramount+ with Showtime

Now part of Paramount+, still home to Billions and Yellowjackets.

  • You can try it free for seven days with Paramount+.

  • Get it bundled with Paramount+ across streaming services, including Hulu and Sling TV.

Sling TV

Credit: Sling TV

 Customizable live TV packages.

  • You can get any Sling TV plan for 50% off your first month.

  • You can also save $38 by prepaying for the first three months of Sling TV.

  • You can sign up for Sling and get AMC+, MGM+, STARZ, and Paramount+ with Showtime free for a month. It’s part of their Premium Pass deal, which normally costs up to $35.98.

  • Students get $10 off for six months when they sign up for Sling with a Student Beans account.
